study.title: Antimicrobial resistance in pathogenic aerobic bacteria causing surgical site infections in Mbarara regional referral hospital, Southwestern Uganda

design.inclusion_criteria_text: Postoperative patients in surgical, obstetrics/post-natal, gynecology, and orthopedics wards with clinical SSI within 30 days of operation who consented to participate.

eligibility.population: Postoperative patients with clinical SSI within 30 days of operation in surgical, obstetrics/post-natal, gynecology, and orthopedics wards.
eligibility.intervention: Antibiotic prophylaxis (ampicillin-cloxacillin, metronidazole, ceftriaxone, ciprofloxacin, gentamycin) and treatment as per local practice.

populations.description: All postoperative patients with clinical SSI within 30 days of operation in surgical, obstetrics/post-natal, gynecology, and orthopedics wards.

provenance.text_snippet: A total of 83 wound swabs were collected from patients with clinical SSIs.

definitions.resistance_definition_text: MDR defined as non-susceptibility to at least one agent in three or more antimicrobial categories.
definitions.outcome_definitions_text: SSI: infection within 30 days of operation; MDR: resistance to three or more antibiotics tested.

lab_methods.specimen_collection_method: Two wound swabs collected aseptically from each patient using sterile cotton swabs by experienced laboratory personnel on the day of presenting with clinical SSI and before application of antiseptics.
lab_methods.culture_method: Blood agar, Chocolate agar, MacConkey agar; aerobic incubation at 35–37°C for 24–48 hours.
lab_methods.QC_measures: Standard Control strains of Escherichia coli ATCC 25922 and Staphylococcus aureus ATCC 25923 as per CLSI guidelines.
lab_methods.organism_identification_method: Colony characteristics, Gram staining, conventional biochemical tests, API20E (BioMérieux) for difficult cases.
lab_methods.lab_capacity_notes: Anaerobic culture not performed due to resource limitations.

amr_proportions.mdr_definition_text: Resistance to three or more antibiotics tested.
amr_proportions.notes: All S. aureus isolates resistant to ampicillin and oxacillin.

provenance.section_heading: Antimicrobial Resistance pattern among the isolates
provenance.text_snippet: All Staphylococcus aureus isolated were resistant to oxacillin and ampicillin

amr_proportions.mdr_definition_text: Resistance to three or more antibiotics tested.
amr_proportions.notes: All S. aureus isolates resistant to oxacillin.

provenance.text_snippet: All Staphylococcus aureus isolated were resistant to oxacillin and ampicillin

amr_proportions.mdr_definition_text: Resistance to three or more antibiotics tested.
amr_proportions.notes: All Klebsiella spp. isolates were MDR and resistant to ampicillin.

provenance.section_heading: Antimicrobial Resistance pattern among the isolates
provenance.text_snippet: All the isolated Klebsiella spp were MDR.

amr_proportions.notes: High resistance to ceftriaxone among Klebsiella spp.

provenance.text_snippet: Klebsiella species showed high resistance to ceftriaxone

amr_proportions.notes: All E. coli isolates resistant to ampicillin.

provenance.section_heading: Antimicrobial Resistance pattern among the isolates

risk_factors_effects.notes: Isolation rate higher in emergency (89.8%) compared to elective (70.59%), p=0.0001.

provenance.text_snippet: Isolation in the present study was found to be higher in emergency procedures compared to elective (p < 0.0001)

risk_factors_effects.notes: Isolation rate higher in dirty wounds (100%) compared to other classes, p=0.0002.

provenance.text_snippet: Isolation rate in the current study was found to be more in dirty wounds... (p < 0.0002)

interventions.description: All study participants received antibiotic prophylaxis, mostly ampicillin-cloxacillin, metronidazole, ceftriaxone, ciprofloxacin, gentamycin.

provenance.text_snippet: All the study participants were subjected to antibiotic prophylaxis and the mostly used antibiotics included ampicillin-cloxacillin, metronidazole, ceftriaxone, ciprofloxacin and gentamycin.

codes.summary: High rates of multidrug resistance (MDR) were observed among both Gram-positive and Gram-negative isolates from SSI patients.

evidence_quotes.quote: Overall 86% of aerobic bacteria isolated were multidrug resistant (MDR) where 65.63% and 96.72% of Gram positive and Gram negative isolates were MDR respectively.

provenance.text_snippet: Overall 86% of aerobic bacteria isolated were multidrug resistant (MDR)...

codes.summary: Irrational use of antibiotics is identified as a major driver of antimicrobial resistance in the study setting.

evidence_quotes.quote: This has majorly been attributed to increasing emergence of antimicrobial resistance due to irrational use of antibiotics.

provenance.text_snippet: This has majorly been attributed to increasing emergence of antimicrobial resistance due to irrational use of antibiotics.

codes.summary: Strict adherence to good sanitation practice and periodic surveillance of SSIs are recommended to reduce spread of drug-resistant pathogens.

evidence_quotes.quote: These findings necessitate judicious antibiotic use and calls for surveillance of SSIs periodically as well as strict adherence to good sanitation practice to reduce spread of drug-resistant pathogens.

provenance.text_snippet: calls for surveillance of SSIs periodically as well as strict adherence to good sanitation practice

funding_conflicts.conflicts_of_interest: The authors declare no competing interests.

provenance.text_snippet: The authors declare no competing interests.

notes_flags.detail: SSI incidence (events and denominator) not reported; only patients with SSI included.

provenance.text_snippet: A total of 83 wound swabs were collected from patients with clinical SSIs.

notes_flags.detail: No data on mortality, reoperations, readmissions, length of stay, or costs.
No explicit reporting of SSI ascertainment window for outcomes; only inclusion criteria.
